verses.verse: Then Zophar, <WH6691> the Naamathite, <WH5284> answered, <WH6030>
"Shouldn't <WH7230> the multitude of words <WH1697> be answered? <WH6030> Should a man <WH376> full of talk <WH8193> be justified? <WH6663>
Should your boastings <WH907> make <WH2790> men <WH4962> hold their peace? <WH2790> When you mock, <WH3932> shall no man make you ashamed? <WH3637>
For you say, <WH559> <WH3948> 'My doctrine is pure. <WH2134> I am clean <WH1249> in your eyes. <WH5869>'
But <WH199> oh that <WH5414> God <WH433> would speak, <WH1696> and open <WH6605> his lips against you, <WH8193>

that he would show <WH5046> you the secrets <WH8587> of wisdom! <WH2451> For true wisdom <WH2451> has two <WH3718> sides. <WH8454> Know <WH3045> therefore that God <WH433> exacts of you less than your iniquity deserves. <WH5771>
"Can you fathom <WH2714> the mystery <WH4672> of God? <WH433> Or can you probe <WH4672> the limits <WH8503> of the Almighty? <WH7706>
They are high <WH1363> as heaven. <WH8064> What can you do? <WH6466> They are deeper <WH6013> than Sheol. <WH7585> What can you know? <WH3045>
Its measure <WH4055> is longer <WH752> than the earth, <WH776> and broader <WH7342> than the sea. <WH3220>
If he passes by, <WH2498> or confines, <WH5462> or convenes <WH6950> a court, <WH7725> then who can oppose him?
For he knows <WH3045> false <WH7723> men. <WH4962> He sees <WH7200> iniquity <WH205> also, <WH995> even though he doesn't consider it.
An empty-headed <WH5014> man <WH376> becomes wise <WH3823> when a man <WH120> is born <WH3205> as a wild donkey <WH6501>'s colt. <WH5895>
"If you set <WH3559> your heart <WH3820> aright, <WH6566> stretch out your hands toward him. <WH3709>
If iniquity <WH205> is in your hand, <WH3027> put it far away. <WH7368> Don't <WH5766> let unrighteousness dwell <WH7931> in your tents. <WH168>
Surely then you shall lift up <WH5375> your face <WH6440> without spot; <WH3971> Yes, <WH3332> you shall be steadfast, and shall not fear: <WH3372>
for you shall forget <WH7911> your misery. <WH5999> You shall remember <WH2142> it as waters <WH4325> that are passed away. <WH5674>
Life <WH2465> shall be clearer <WH6965> than the noonday. <WH6672> Though there is darkness, <WH5774> it shall be as the morning. <WH1242>
You shall be secure, <WH982> because there is <WH3426> hope. <WH8615> Yes, <WH2658> you shall search, and shall take your rest <WH7901> in safety. <WH983>
Also you shall lie down, <WH7257> and none shall make you afraid. <WH2729> Yes, <WH7227> many shall court <WH2470> your favor. <WH6440>
But the eyes <WH5869> of the wicked <WH7563> shall fail. <WH3615> They shall have no way to flee. <WH6> Their hope <WH8615> shall be the giving up <WH4646> of the spirit. <WH5315>"
